name: Gjergj Kastrioti Skanderbeg
bio_markdown: Military commander who led the League of Lezhë against the Ottoman Empire.
impact_markdown: Symbol of resistance and unity; central to Albanian identity.

name: Isa Boletini
bio_markdown: Prominent Albanian nationalist and guerrilla leader from Kosovo.
impact_markdown: Symbol of Albanian resistance during the late Ottoman period and independence era.

name: Ismail Qemali
bio_markdown: Leader of the Albanian Declaration of Independence in 1912.
impact_markdown: First Prime Minister of independent Albania.

name: Mother Teresa
bio_markdown: Catholic nun and missionary of Albanian heritage, known for her charitable work in India.
impact_markdown: Recipient of the Nobel Peace Prize for her humanitarian efforts.

name: Adem Jashari
bio_markdown: Co-founder of the Kosovo Liberation Army (KLA).
impact_markdown: Became a national hero for his role in the Kosovo War.

name: Ibrahim Rugova
bio_markdown: First President of Kosovo and advocate of peaceful resistance.
impact_markdown: Known as the 'Gandhi of the Balkans' for his non-violent approach.

name: Hasan Prishtina
bio_markdown: Key figure in the Albanian national movement and former Prime Minister of Albania.
impact_markdown: Promoted Albanian independence and education reforms.

name: Gjergj Fishta
bio_markdown: Franciscan friar and author of the Albanian national epic 'Lahuta e Malcís'.
impact_markdown: Major figure in Albanian literature and national identity.

name: Ndre Mjeda
bio_markdown: Influential Albanian poet, priest, and linguist.
impact_markdown: Contributed to Albanian literature and language standardization.
